messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Want to be interviewed for unschooling article?
messages.msgSnippet: Oops, How about Peter KilBorn and pekilB@NYTimes.com. Now I feel like a real reporter, misspelling names and everything! Billy http://www.FUN-Books.com
messages.messageBody:
Oops,
 
How about Peter KilBorn and pekilB@....
 
Now I feel like a real reporter, misspelling names and everything!
 
Billy
http://www.FUN-Books.com
http://www.unschooling.org
 
-----Original Message-----
From: Sue [mailto:sue.m.e@...]
Sent: Thursday, May 18, 2000 3:42 AM
To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Want to be interviewed for unschooling article?



> Peter Kilvorn is in the Washington D.C. Bureau of the New York Times, but is
> willing to travel outside the area if necessary. If you would like to
> contact him for more information or to offer your family for an interview,
> you can call him at (202) 862-0361, or e-mail him at PeKilv@...

Billy,

I just sent an email to him but it cam back with the message:
The original message was received at Thu, 18 May 2000 09:34:53 - 0400 (EDT)
from tango.SoftHome.net [204.144.231.49]

----- The following addresses had permanent fatal errors -----
< PeKilv@... >

----- Transcript of session follows -----
... while talking to mailgate.nytimes.com.:
>>> RCPT To:< PeKilv@... >
<<< 550 < PeKilv@... >... User unknown
550 < PeKilv@... >... User unknown

Are you sure that the email address is correct. 



  Sue   

The Winona Farm in Minnesota Welcomes Unschoolers All Year Round
My website:      http://members.xoom.com/sue_m_e
Farm website:    http://members.xoom.com/winfarm/
Farm newsletter: http://www.onelist.com/subscribe/Winonafarm

"To believe in something, and not to live it, 
 is to be dishonest."   -Mahatma Gandhi

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Want to be interviewed for unschooling article?
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 05/18/2000 1:25:42 PM !!!First Boot!!!, FUNLists@IQCweb.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 05/18/2000 1:25:42 PM !!!First Boot!!!,
FUNLists@... writes:

<< t he really wants to do is to spend some time with
a family to see what kind of things go on during a "typical" day. I've
explained to him that there is no such thing as a typical unschooler or a
typical unschooling day, but he is hoping to catch one of those "aha!"
moments when a kid gets excited by something they are doing or finally
catches on to something they have been trying to understand.
>>


But no pressure!

No thanks.

Gosh, I would have to dust!

Nance
